about.label: About me
about.title: Technical background with an applied security focus.
about.paragraph1: I'm a software engineer in my final year of studies, with a two-year university specialization in applied cybersecurity. That journey let me integrate security best practices into backend work, authentication, and deployments without losing sight of the user experience.
about.paragraph2: I work on SaaS solutions, API integrations, and automation with Python and JavaScript. My security focus is practical: I design coherent systems with clear data flows and documentation that keep every delivery maintainable and lower risk.
about.collaborationText: Open to technical collaborations, cross-project synergies, or simply exchanging ideas about product and development. Reach out via LinkedIn.

kobra.title: Financial platform supporting Cybersur daily operations.
kobra.paragraph1: Kobra is the custom solution I built for Cybersur. With a stack, it centralizes billing, payments, and notifications so the finance team works with coherent, up-to-date information.
kobra.paragraph2: Scheduled cronjobs manage data exports and cleaning, while alert and reminder pipelines log every action. The entire flow is designed for immediate visibility and to reduce manual, repetitive tasks.

bullets.first: Automatic workflows that drastically reduce follow-up and collection times.
bullets.second: Traceable cronjobs for exports and cleaning routines to keep data consistent.
bullets.third: Internal dashboards with essential metrics for tracking payments and pendings.

kobra.next: Next iteration: expand internal financial reports and automate reconciliations.
kobra.diagramContent:
Cybersur Team
    ↓
FastAPI API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails & Reminders
    └─ Scheduled Cronjobs → CSV Reports

beatlist.title: Professional playlist management with the official Spotify seal.
beatlist.paragraph1: BeatList is the platform for music lovers, curators, and creators who need something more powerful than the native Spotify manager. It brings together advanced administration, discovery, and analytics in a seamless experience.
beatlist.paragraph2: Thanks to official integration with the and approved authentication, the Flask backend accesses extended data with professional stability and delegates heavy analysis to Celery to keep the experience smooth. The JavaScript frontend offers dashboards and a web player with custom micro-interactions.

bullets.first: Merge, clean up, and reorganize playlists with smart rules based on metrics like energy or danceability.
bullets.second: Recommendation engine by favorite artists and genres, plus dashboards showing listening habits.
bullets.third: Analyses handled by Celery to process data in the background and offer precise metrics without affecting user experience.

beatlist.next: Possible evolutions: add collaborative mode or insight exports in future versions.
beatlist.diagramContent:
Web Client
    ↓
Flask API (OAuth 2.0 Spotify)
    ↓
Celery workers → Heavy analysis & metrics
    ↓
JS Dashboards + Player

mesasya.title: Smart reservations for restaurant chains.
mesasya.paragraph1: MesasYa is a platform that digitizes reservation management for restaurants with multiple locations. It offers granular occupancy control, communication automation, and manager-ready dashboards.
mesasya.paragraph2: With as the base, the solution is deployed with Docker Compose and security best practices, maintaining customizable workflows by zone, service, and team. Analytics and exports adapt to business decisions.

bullets.first: Interactive floor plans configurable by location, zone, and service.
bullets.second: Automatic notifications for internal teams and end customers.
bullets.third: Demand, capacity, and performance indicators exportable for strategic decisions.

mesasya.next: Next steps: integrate automatic reports and continue improving the manager experience.
mesasya.diagramContent:
Staff and online bookings
    ↓
Flask API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails & SMS
    └─ Docker Compose → Coordinated services

orderya.title: Unified production and delivery management.
orderya.paragraph1: Built with for maximum speed, it allows managing complex catalogs, prices, and users with differentiated roles. All deployed securely and scalably.
orderya.paragraph2: Built with for maximum speed, it allows managing complex catalogs, prices, and users with differentiated roles. All of this is deployed securely and scalably.

bullets.first: Unified order portal that eliminates transcription errors.

trato.title: Agile CRM for quotes, follow-ups, and reminders.
trato.paragraph1: Trato is the lightweight CRM that centralizes quotes, follow-ups, and reminders in a fast flow. On a stack deployed with Uvicorn, it lets sales teams work without friction.
trato.paragraph2: Invite codes control company and user sign-ups, while Celery tasks automate reminders and daily summaries. The panel prioritizes operational speed on desktop and mobile.

bullets.first: Guided quote entry with customizable statuses and opportunity comments.
bullets.second: Automatic reminders managed by Celery and internal notifications.
bullets.third: Containerized deployment on the main VPS with backups and basic monitoring.

trato.next: Next steps: expand conversion metrics and integrate automatic reports for management.

micartaya.title: 360º management of the restaurant experience.
micartaya.paragraph1: MiCartaYa is a comprehensive solution to digitize interaction between the restaurant and the customer. Based on and two-way communication, it makes order flow instant and error-free.
micartaya.paragraph2: The system stands out for its remote printing engine that connects the cloud with physical kitchen printers, and an administration panel that allows managing complex menus with videos and multi-language support dynamically.

bullets.first: Real-time order reception with latency under 1 second thanks to WebSockets.
bullets.second: Total stock control and product availability with immediate reflection in the public menu.
bullets.third: Centralized management of multiple sedes, allergens, and visual brand customization.

micartaya.next: Next steps: payment gateway integration and support for home delivery.
micartaya.diagramContent:
Diner (QR) / Staff
    ↓
FastAPI (WebSockets) → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Printer Client (Local) → Kitchen Ticket
    └─ Dashboard (React) → Notifications

ponme.title: AI applied to smart personal style management.
ponme.paragraph1: Ponme democratizes use of generative AI to solve the daily 'what do I wear' dilemma. It integrates the Gemini API to understand not just what clothes you have, but how to combine them by context.
ponme.paragraph2: The app processes images locally to remove backgrounds and uses multimodal models to extract garment metadata (color, fabric, style), allowing you to create a 'digital wardrobe' in minutes.

bullets.first: Smart outfit generation based on specific plans and weather variables.
bullets.second: Device-side image processing to guarantee privacy and speed.
bullets.third: Usage tracking system to help rotate garments and improve sustainability.

ponme.next: Next steps: smart packing planner and purchase suggestions based on closet gaps.
ponme.diagramContent:
User (Mobile/PWA)
    ↓
FastAPI → PostgreSQL
    │
    ├─ Google Gemini API → Image Analysis
    └─ Rembg (Local) → Garment Segmentation

mesasya.label: Case study 01
mesasya.title: MesasYa — Multi-location SaaS Reservations
mesasya.paragraph1: MesasYa is a digitalizing booking management for restaurants with multiple locations. It brings interactive floor plans, customizable rules, and real-time notifications so every service runs without surprises.
mesasya.paragraph2: The backend uses Docker Compose and security best practices. Each restaurant configures zones, services, languages, and specific workflows without losing stability or traceability.

bullets.first: Floor plans configurable with rules by location, zones, and special events.
bullets.second: Automatic table assignment and real-time notifications for staff and customers.
bullets.third: BI-ready exports and metrics that follow business decisions.

mesasya.nextText: Automatic report integration and management experience optimization.
mesasya.schemaContent:
Web Bookings / staff
    ↓
Flask API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails/SMS
    └─ Docker Compose coordinates services

micartaya.label: Case study 02
micartaya.title: MiCartaYa — Full Table Digitization
micartaya.paragraph1: MiCartaYa redefines restaurant interaction through a platform of digital menus and self-managed ordering. It solves the manual order-taking bottleneck and ensures menu information is always up to date.
micartaya.paragraph2: The core of the project is a high-availability WebSockets system connecting diners to the restaurant dashboard and printing hardware, eliminating transcription errors and optimizing service times.

bullets.first: Drastic reduction in wait time for orders and payments.
bullets.second: Dynamic management of prices and availability with a single click.
bullets.third: Automatic kitchen and bar ticket printing via TCP/IP and USB protocols.

micartaya.nextText: Integrated payments from table and customer loyalty features.
micartaya.schemaContent:
Diner (Mobile)
    ↓
Nginx → FastAPI (WS)
    │
    ├─ PostgreSQL / Redis
    └─ Printer Script (Local) → POS

orderya.label: Case study 03
orderya.title: OrderYa — Comprehensive Order Management
orderya.paragraph1: OrderYa eliminates order management chaos between bakeries and points of sale. It replaces spreadsheets and scattered messages with a centralized platform where each shop orders intuitively and the bakery sees consolidated demand.
orderya.paragraph2: Developed with and server-side rendering (Jinja2) for speed and simplicity, the system handles complex catalogs, price lists by customer, and automatic delivery order generation.

bullets.first: Shop portal with real-time history and status.
bullets.second: Barcode scanning to speed up order creation.
bullets.third: Template creation, product management, and data export.

trato.title: Trato — Agile CRM for Sales Teams
trato.paragraph1: Trato centralizes quotes, follow-ups, and reminders in a lightweight CRM for sales teams. With a backend running with Uvicorn, it prioritizes response speed and clarity for every opportunity.
trato.paragraph2: Companies access via invite codes and manage pipelines with customizable statuses, interaction timelines, and automatic alerts. Celery tasks coordinate reminders, email sends, and daily summaries from the main VPS.

bullets.first: Controlled company and user sign-ups through invite codes.
bullets.second: Follow-ups with automatic reminders and centralized timeline per opportunity.
bullets.third: Containerized deployment on main VPS with backups and Celery task monitoring.

beatlist.paragraph1: BeatList follows curators and creators who need to go beyond the standard Spotify manager. It connects the with advanced analysis and interactive experiences approved by Spotify for Developers.

ponme.label: Case study 07
ponme.title: Ponme — Personal Style & AI Assistant
ponme.paragraph1: Ponme is a B2C platform applying multimodal models for personal wardrobe management. It allows users to digitize their clothes and receive smart outfit suggestions generated by Gemini.
ponme.paragraph2: Using local computer vision techniques for image segmentation and advanced LLM reasoning for style combination, Ponme offers a seamless experience that optimizes use of existing garments.

bullets.first: AI-suggested combinations considering event context and local weather.
bullets.second: Automatic garment cataloging (type, color, material) via visual analysis.
bullets.third: PWA mode for a mobile-native experience with fast load and offline functionality.

ponme.nextText: Circular purchase recommendation algorithms and social fashion sharing.
